# The `LoopConstrainer` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class is used to constrain loops to run within a given iteration space. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This class is used to constrain loops to run within a given iteration space.

The algorithm this class implements is given a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> and a range &#91;Begin, End). The algorithm then tries to break out a &quot;main loop&quot; out of the loop it is given in a way that the &quot;main loop&quot; runs with the induction variable in a subset of &#91;Begin, End). The algorithm emits appropriate pre and post loops to run any remaining iterations. The pre loop runs any iterations in which the induction variable is &lt; Begin, and the post loop runs any iterations in which the induction variable is &gt;= End.

Definition at line 95 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/loopconstrainer-h">LoopConstrainer.h</a>.
